metadata.title: CVE-2014-4348 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 4.2.xbefore 4.2.4 allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary webscript or HTML via a crafted (1) database name or (2) table name that isimproperly handled after presence in (a) the favorite list or (b) recenttables.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4348` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.2.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.2.5-1').
